channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Justice Department’s New Target in D.C., and a Surge of Federal Agents in Minnesota
item.description: Plus, Russia’s push to indoctrinate Ukrainian kids.

item.title: Nearly 15,000 Nurses Go on Strike at Major New York City Hospitals
item.description: Workers are demanding more robust staffing levels and higher pay. The strike comes three years after a smaller job action won significant gains.

item.title: Iran Prepared for War but Ready to Negotiate With U.S., Foreign Minister Says
item.description: The comments came after President Trump said he was “ looking at some very strong options” to curb Iran’s harsh repression of antigovernment protests.

item.title: U.S. Citizens Are Joining the Military to Protect Undocumented Parents
item.description: Amid an ICE crackdown in her area, an Oregon National Guard recruiter offers U.S. citizens a way to save their immigrant parents.

item.title: How IVF has led to a record number of single moms in their 40s
item.description: Who gets to be a parent has been reshaped by IVF: Single women in their 40s are increasingly opting to become moms.

item.title: Marrying for health insurance? The ACA cost crisis forces some drastic choices
item.description: While Congress debates bringing back Affordable Care Act subsidies , many Americans have already made life-altering decisions to afford health care.

item.title: Who are the figure skaters representing Team USA? Key names and backstories to know
item.description: Sixteen U.S. figure skaters are competing in all four Olympic disciplines: men's, women's, pairs and ice dance. The team includes a mix of seasoned ve...

item.title: How to responsibly recycle your children's old toys
item.description: Now that the holiday gift-giving season is over, parents may be looking for ways to recycle or donate their children's old toys. Here's what you need ...

item.title: Nikki Glaser’s Monologue, Teyana Taylor’s Speech and Other Moments From the 2026 Globes
item.description: Nikki Glaser returned as host and killed, while Teyana Taylor delivered the speech of the night. Then there were those awful production choices.

item.title: Exercise is as effective as medication in treating depression, study finds
item.description: New research shows exercise is as effective as medication at reducing symptoms of depression. And you don't need to run a marathon to see benefits. So...

item.title: Latin America Reacts to Trump’s Interventionism
item.description: Jack Nicas, our Mexico City bureau chief, walks us through the ways Latin American leaders are reacting to the Trump administration’s attack on Venezu...

item.title: Russian Missiles Failed in Venezuela During U.S. Attack
item.description: The Venezuelan regime had high-powered air defense systems from its allies in the Kremlin, but failed to set much of it up.

item.title: Death Toll Surges in Iran Protests
item.description: Crowds gathered at a morgue outside Tehran as the death toll from protests in Iran surged. President Trump hinted on Sunday that the United States may...

item.title: Two Months After Cease-Fire, Israel Is Still Demolishing Gaza
item.description: More than 2,500 buildings have been destroyed since the start of the cease-fire, according to a New York Times analysis. Israel says it is demilitariz...

item.title: Iran Prepared for War but Ready to Negotiate With U.S., Foreign Minister Says
item.description: The comments came after President Trump said he was “ looking at some very strong options” to curb Iran’s harsh repression of antigovernment protests.
